com.adidas.connect.ui.social

Class SocialNetworkManagersHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adidas.connect.ui.social.SocialNetworkManagersHolder

  • public class SocialNetworkManagersHolder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for holding references for every social network login manager implemented by client apps.

    This solution is necessary as we need to pass instances of those managers between activities (understanding the manager as the object that implements InternalSocialNetworkLoginManager) and we can't make them Parcelable nor Serializable for the following reasons:

    1.- It would force the client apps to add a Parcelable implementation on their managers, or to make sure that every single object contained on them are Serializable.

    2.- At least in the Facebook SDK case (the only one implemented by the time of writing this), we need to use a CallbackManager object, which is NOT Parcelable nor Serializable, so this is not a valid solution.

    On this class we'll keep references to those managers implementations using a Map and will provide public access to them.

    This class implements the Singleton Anti-pattern in order to achieve the situation described above and for this reason we should pay specific attention to how it behaves.

    The implementation of the map that will hold all of the information chosen for this situation is a ConcurrentHashMap in order to provide some thread-safety when performing IO operations over it
